lexUnit.name: astute.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having an ability to assess situations or people accurately.

sentence.text: Barley is much too astute to state this baldly , but it informs his every strategy as author .
For one thing , Jenkins is far too astute to fall for that , and for another other Welsh clubs are enthusiastic in his support .
No doubt all judges will be astute to ensure that counsel does not in any way impugn or criticise the minister 's statements or his reasoning .

Bannister is candid in his views , vivid and thorough in his description , generous and perceptive in his praise of his colleagues and astute in his own observations .
She always had an eye for a bargain and was very astute in her shopping .
Women have proved to be astute in business .

` How very astute of you , Luke , " she remarked .
Very astute of you to notice that .

Giolitti was an astute politician who satisfied the socialist leanings of the populace with a series of enlightened reforms , but who failed to do anything to control the corruption of those in power .
